intro: Strobilanthes suborbicularis, commonly known as the broad-leaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, orbicular-shaped leaves. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences with tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is a subject of interest in botanical research and conservation efforts.
